title: slow data refresh rate
content:
I use firefox as my browser and to operate my 3d printers web interface, on my local network

with firefox the data that the printers display is very slow to update, for example if i input a movement command of say 10mm firefox takes at least a few second to display the number that corresponds to the movement change, its definitely firefox as opening the very same machine and sending machine commands in any other browser does not result in a data lag.
creator: mark.richard.duncan

title: Impedir abras fixas de abrirem novo endereço
content: Olá. Quando estou em uma aba fixada e, sem perceber, digito um novo endereço na barra de endereços, a página é aberta na mesma aba fixada, o que é indesejável. Gostaria de saber se há a possibilidade de, ao digitar um endereço na barra de endereços a partir de uma aba fixada, se a página poderia ser aberta em uma nova aba, preservando a aba fixada. No Safari, por exemplo, se estou em uma aba fixada e digito um novo endereço, a página é aberta em uma nova aba, preservando a aba fixada. Desde já lhes agradeço pela atenção. Henrique

title: Always open in container deeper than the domain
content:
I love the containers and have been using it for a long time already, but one thing that I couldn't find a solution is to have two URL's within the same domain to "always open" in different containers.

I do have other examples, but the basic ones is github and azure devops.

I have my own place and my company one, they have the same domain but different logins (GitHub not quite, but it has a second authentication on top of it for the enterprise one), basically it happens like that:

Company: https://dev.azure.com/CompanyName Persona: https://dev.azure.com/Mine

When I set to always open in a container for each of them, both goes to the same container, which is annoying because I have a different login for each of them, for GitHub is kinda similar, I do use my personal github account for my companies one as well, but for my companies organization there is AAD integration and so I need to have it authentication with the AAD on top of my regular login, and "my companies container" is the only one already authenticated there.
creator: marleixo

title: suddenly can't load Duolingo.com using Firefox on Windows computer
content:
I found this thread, "I cannot open the Duolingo website from my Firefox browser on MAC", here in this forum, which describes the same problemI'm having. That thread was posted about a year ago and is now archived.

For me, the problem is not with MAC but with Windows.

I can reach the login page for duolingo.com using either Firefox or Edge, but after giving my log-in information, the website gets into an endless loading loop when I try to use Firefox. It still loads correctly in Edge and I can use that.

I've been using Duolingo in FF 102.7.0 esr (32-bit) (and all previous esr versions) with no problem until today and I've been using it for years.

I clear the cache every time I close the browser. I cleared it multiple times and rebooted the computer. I tried disabling the ad-blockeer which has never been a problem before. None of these things helped.

Thanks for any thoughts on this.
creator: FoxwoodS

title: FireFox portable asking to create/choose profile when launching links
content:
Hello,

  • FF 109.0.1 (64-bit) PORTABLE version
  • Windows10 Home

Whenever I click on a link in another Windows program (in this case I am updating an Uninstaller program) I see a window appear asking me choose or create a FF profile to use. No profiles are listed.

But I am using a profile all the time. Filled with hundreds of bookmarks. I use FF Portable and the browser is kept in a custom folder i made:

C:\Program Files Portable\Firefox Portable

How can I make FF always just use the current profile that I.m in all the time? When I click on an external link a tab should just open in my current main profile. Why is it telling me to make a new one?

Thanks for your help.

title: Website not loading on Firefox browser on some devices
content:
Hi there, I'm having an issue where my website isn't loading on Firefox browser on some devices. I've checked all the issues from my side and the website, but haven't been able to detect anything.

I've tested the website on different devices and different networks, and it seems to be working fine on other browsers, such as Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge. However, when I try to load the website on Firefox, it just hangs and doesn't load at all.

I'm not sure what the issue could be, as the website doesn't seem to be having any problems on other browsers. I've tried disabling my extensions, clearing my cache and cookies, and restarting my browser, but nothing seems to be working.

Is there anything else I can try to resolve this issue, or could someone from the support team please help me out? I really appreciate any advice or assistance you can offer.

Thank you in advance!

title: Awesome Screenshot add-on and Add-ons Security
content:
Hello,

My Apple ID got compromised - someone logged in to my Apple online store account, placed an order with the credit card associated with the account, and actually picked up the order in an Apple store.

An Apple remote adviser has spent a considerable amount of time with me over the phone trying to identify how my Apple account was possibly compromised. Going through the Apps and browser add-ons on my computer (MacOS Ventura) , he concluded that likely, my Apple password was stolen through the Awesome Screenshot Firefox browser add-on.

I would like to ask your opinion whether you think it is possible that this would be the case.

Further info

  • I haven't actually used the given add-on for long time
  • I have an active ESET firewall on my computer. After the incident, I ran a full scan, and the firewall didn't find anything.
creator: atomh

title: FF is preventing me from accessing a website and fix instructions dont seem to apply
content:
Via google search, I clicked on https://company.bk.com/pdfs/nutrition.pdf, where it said: Invalid SSL certificate Error code 526 Visit cloudflare.com for more information.

[FYI, I don't care, but I never heard of cloudflare.]

I then click on 'additonal troubleshooting information.' on this failure page where it says: 

Error 526 occurs when these two conditions are true: 
   Cloudflare cannot validate the SSL certificate at your origin web server, and    Full SSL (Strict) SSL is set in the Overview tab of your Cloudflare SSL/TLS app.

Resolution

For a potential quick fix, set SSL to Full instead of Full (strict) in the Overview tab of your Cloudflare SSL/TLS app for the domain.

So I go to Settings>Privacy and Security. First, no Overview tab. But under enhanced tracking protection, I have Standard selected and with strict one of the options, I think I'm where I supposed to be NO!. So I search for SSL, and there are no hits.

Thus I am in a total failure state, unable to do what should have taken 1 minute to easily find out!

WHY CAN'T I JUST TURN THIS OFF FOR THIS ONE INSTANCE???? I mean, it's Burger King, and all I NEED NOW is nutritional info for what I just ate and there is no way on that results page to temporarily turn off the problem. Cloudflare? CloutFailure is more like it. They have taken my choice to choose!

This so frustrating, such a simple thing, why isn't there something to temp turn off?
creator: cglenn

title: UI corruption when forcing Firefox to use AMD Zen 4 iGPU on Windows
content:
Hi, when forcing Firefox to use the GPU integrated in my AMD 7700X, my UI is getting displayed in a weird way as soon as I start using my mouse (see attached screenshot).

I've tried re-installing Firefox, disabling all themes and add-ons, refreshing, disabling HW-acceleration, and creating a new profile. (Followed the guide at this support article) However, none of these fixed my Problems. Interestingly, the Troubleshoot-Mode seems to fix the problem.

Is there anything else I can try?

Cheers, Zihark

Note that the shared troubleshooting information is from an un-corrupted instance that uses my dedicated GPU instead of the iGPU.
creator: Zihark

title: Memoria RAM
content: Hola buenas, os comento, mi problema en firefox no es sobre lentitud, el programa va de categoría y en todo este tiempo que he usado firefox me va de maravilla. Pero tengo un problema, no se por que de memoria firefox me está consumiendo con solo estar escribiendo esto 200MB, luego cundo busco algo o estoy viendo videos asciende a 500Mb, sinceramente no se por que sucede(no se si es normal que me suceda con firefox) pero pensé que era windows 11 y volví al windows 10 y sigue igual. El problema de esto es que por la cantidad que me consume la batería del portátil se me va volando. En cambio uso google chrome y utiliza muchísimo menos memoria que firefox. Existe alguna solución para que firefox consuma menos RAM? Saludos
creator: pablojuegos452
